name: Hotel Occidental

reviews.title: Great, clean, and really friendly!
reviews.text: This hotel is walking distance from downtown sandiego and balboa park. Our stay was fantastic: the rooms were immaculately clean and well appointed, the hotel was quiet, and the staff were friendly and helpful. The night staff at the desk was even polite and courteous; nice to see when at most hotels you cant even find the night person.
All in all, this hotel will be getting our business any time we go back to the San Diego area.
reviews.title: Very recommendable hotel. I like this hotel.

reviews.text: I visited San Diego for a english course at LSI.
reviews.title: Loved the Occidental

reviews.text: I stud at the Occidental for 4 weeks and I really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: I loved it, felt like home the staff was like family so helpful and friendly.

likes.disliked: — Meet Lisa! She's awsome so friendly, helful and fun.

reviews.text: I had a single room with my own bathroom.
reviews.title: Not all that great

reviews.text: There were no mix-ups with my reservation and checking in was fast. Friendly, helpful staff and lots of green apples at the front door.
reviews.title: Small, Noisy, Yet Convenient

likes.liked: — Close location to attractions, cheap price.
likes.disliked: — Noisy patio & smokers outside at midnight; 747 flyby's.

reviews.text: Yes, I also had the dreaded room 109. It's a small twin bed, not so hard. The window faces the patio area which unfortunately is a smoking area. So if your window is open you get the smoke drifing in as well as loud conversation. There should be a curfew or cut-off time for the patio where it is closed after midnight. I understand people's "clocks" are different with various time zones but give a guy a break!
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The jets do fly close, but it's really no big deal. Big fan, cable TV was adequate. The showers in the hallway were clean but being used at times inconvenient. The bathroom area has high ceiling and a loud echo. Don't slam the toilet lid down unless you want jarred eardrums!
reviews.title: Can we say jail cell?
Wonderful Value!
reviews.text: Good location, near Balboa Park, the Zoo and a short walk to the trolley to get to the convention center.
I got what I got for the cheap price. I may fork over a bit more money for the convenience of a personal shower, however.
reviews.title: San Diego Value
Loved the H.O.
reviews.text: Stayed at the H.O. during a conference that attracted over 40,000 (!) participants to the city of San Diego. That being said, I waited late to reserve a hotel and found that all rooms had been booked..except for Hotel Occidental. I must admit I was very very surprised about how awesome this palce was. First and foremost the hotel was spotless. This is probably the most important factor when I book a hotel. My room had a refridgerator, microwave, sink, and TV. The hotel is a 15 minute walk to the Convention Center. This is a doable walk during the day but I would not recommend it at night. The hotel is close to Balboa Park. My only complaint is the hotel's WiFi. It was very shoddy and would only work in like two or 3 minute bursts. This is a small complaint however as the convention center provided free wifi during the conference. Highly Recommended hotel.

reviews.title: Hotel Occidental
reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located, near Balboa Park and the Gaslamp Quarter. The room we had was small and very bare bones in its furnishings, with exposed pipes under the ceiling. The bathroom had no sink and no fan, and the kitchenette was right in the bedroom. The bed was comfortable, the premises clean, the continental breakfast was excellent and the staff was pleasant and helpful. Unfortunately the hotel is in the flight path of airplanes descending to land at the airport, and the resulting noise was unpleasant and disruptive.

....no, it was really the opposite. We stayed for 2 weeks and had a really good time. The staff was great, especially Richard and Nick. The room we stayed in was not very big, but comfortable and very clean. The shared bathrooms are really not a big deal, you have it for yourself as soon as you look the door. It was also always clean. The showers could have a litte more presure, though :-) The only downside was the internet, they have cable in the rooms and wireless. The time we were there, it never really worked well, but they did their best to fix it. The wireless outside on the patio always worked fine. There is gated parking (4 spots), but you can safe your money and park on the one side on the street for free in front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Nightmare on Elm Street...

likes.liked: — The Price, The Staff, The Room

reviews.title: Occidental is the best
reviews.text: We had a great time and would always come back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Billy & Thomas
reviews.title: A San Diego Secret

likes.liked: — The great location, Customer Service, and beautiful accomodations
likes.disliked: — Parking can be a little tough, but you dont really need a car

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is great! The staff is unbelievably friendly!!! Seriously, the manager, Lisa, is the most helpful person ever. We were pleased with all of the staff. The housekeeping staff was superb. They were really great...even washed our dishes! Our room was really small, but we had a toilet right in our room and also a kitchenette. The shared showers were no big deal at all...they were always super clean and it was a cozy little room with plenty of room in the shower. My only complaint is the bed. I swear it was the squeakiest bed in the entire universe! And I am really not a picky person. Other than that, the hotel was really quiet. The breakfast was included in the price and was EXCELLENT. They had fresh muffins, cereal, oatmeal, fruit, bottled water, coffee, juice, milk. There is a courtyard/garden area that is very pretty. There is also a laundry room. One of the employees overheard me talking about needing a dryer sheet, and he went into the housekeeping room and gave me some! How nice. This is also the same guy that flagged down a taxi in the middle of traffic and helped me with my heavy suitcase all from the kindness of his heart. The location is good too, although not in the best part of town. But the security was impeccable. It is in walking distance of Balboa Park (the zoo), the trolley station, downtown, and Little Italy. STAY HERE. You won't be disappointed. =)
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel if you are visiting San Diego and don't want to spend at least $150 a day. Location is close to Balboa Park and not too far from Downtown either. The shared bathrooms and showers are very clean. The (free) breakfast is simple but very well done. Service is A+.
reviews.title: Great budget stay

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for 10 nights at Occidental and we have come to a conclusion that... we will go back again!
reviews.title: Hotel Occidental, GREAT!

likes.liked: — location,cleanliness,friendly staff,breakfast,comfortable bed, free DVD rentals,variety in room types

reviews.text: The first impression was good.. very umquie and nice building, clean environment and we were being warmly welcomed.Actually we have booked a half bath (with only WC) room and wanted to change to a full bath room on our day of arrival, but the staff rest assured that we will be fine with the half bath .... and true enough.. it's common 'private' bath is great and clean ...do see for yourself!
reviews.title: Excellent inexpensive hotel with free bicycles

likes.disliked: — airport and traffic noise in morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thru'out the stay we really felt at home as the staff were very friendly and you will know they are always there to give advise and to lend a hand! And I must really commend on their housekeeping... i think they really do a great job.. always spotless clean! Also, we really appreciated their breakfast, esp with fresh fruits and mineral water daily!
reviews.title: The Occidental is fabulous!!

likes.liked: — The location (walking distance to Balboa Park & Gas Lamp District) and the price

description: Our beautiful garden patio is a lovely place to enjoy a cup a coffee, our free yummy breakfast before taking out one of our free bikes to tour the city, Balboa Park and the Zoo.
